index.head: CHECK YOUR UNDERSTANDING
index.screenText:
Select the appropriate options.
Q10. A bacterial culture follows the growth equation y = 4(2)x where y is the number of bacteria after x seconds. Which of the following graphs represents the growth curve? What is the number of bacteria at the start? What is the rate constant?

options.option: <font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph d, starting number of bacteria = 4, k = 1 s<sup>-1</sup> </font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph a, starting number of bacteria = 4, k = -1 s<sup>-1</sup> </font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph c, starting number of bacteria = 2, k = 1 s<sup>-1</sup></font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph b, starting number of bacteria = -4, k = -1 s<sup>-1</sup></font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph a, starting number of bacteria = 4, k = unknown</font>

index.FeedbackIncorrect:
Not Quite!

The Correct Answer is: Option A

Read the explanation below to validate your answer.
From the given equation, at x = 0, y = 4. At x = 1, y = 8. Only graph d passes through these two points: (0,1) and (1, 8)). By comparing the given equation with Y = N0(2)kx we see the starting number of bacteria N0 = 4, and k = 1 s-1.
